localizedDescriptions.en: Document to communicate information to others, commonly in response to a request from another party.

annotations.Notes.Authors Note: This description may be useful to display in the UI: Document to communicate relevant patient information and summary recommendations from ReSPECT (Recommended Summary Plan for Emergency Care and Treatment) process.

localizedDescriptions.en: The status of the entire report. Note: This is not the status of any of the report components.
Top level heading for capturing details of ReSPECT process.
Heading containing summary of relevant information for the ReSPECT process.
Narrative and structured details of relevant information.
Narrative summary or overview about a patient, specifically from the perspective of a healthcare provider, and with or without associated interpretations.
The summary, assessment, conclusions or evaluation of the clinical findings.
Details of other relevant planning documents and where to find them (e.g. Advance Decision to Refuse Treatment, Advance Care Plan). Also include known wishes about organ donation.
Pointer to advance planning documentation.
Statement about presence and location of advance planning documents such as Advance Decision to Refuse Treatment or Anticipatory Care Planning.
Description or name of advance planning document such as advance decision to refuse treatment or anticipatory care planning.
Location of advance planning document.
Details about an multimedia representation of the clinical data.
Multimedia representation of the clinical observation or finding.
Details of personal preferences to guide this ReSPECT plan (where the person has capacity).
The subject's preferred priorities of care and 'What matters'.

Indication on a scale of 1 - 100 of where priority for care should be. 1 indicates absolute priority on sustaining life (even at the expense of comfort) and 100 indicates absolute priority on comfort (even at the expense of sustaining life).
A narrative statement by the patient on their preferred priorities of care.

annotations.comment: In the UI, this should be represented as 'Considering the above priorities. what is most important to you? (optional)'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Summary of clinical recommendations for emergency care and treatment.
A suggestion, advice or proposal for clinical management.

annotations.Notes.Authors Note: This description may be useful to display in the UI: Summary of agreed and realistic clinical recommendations for emergency care and treatment.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description of the recommendation.

annotations.Notes.Authors Note: This description may be useful to display in the UI: Focus on life-sustaining treatment or symptom control according to clinical guidance on specific interventions specified below.
annotations.comment: May be coded, using a terminology, if required.

localizedDescriptions.en: Justifications for the recommendation.

annotations.Notes.Authors Note: This description may be useful to display in the UI: Clinician's guidance on specific interventions that may or may not be wanted or be clinically appropriate, including being taken or admitted to hospital +/- receiving life support.

localizedDescriptions.en: The advance recommendation as to whether cardio-pulmonary resuscitation should be undertaken or not. This is generally referred to in UK clinical guidance as the CPR (Cardio-pulmonary resuscitation) decision.
The advance recommendation as to whether cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) should be attempted. In some cases a clear answer may not be available to the recording clinician.

list.label: CPR attempts recommended adult or child

localizedLabels.en: CPR attempts recommended adult or child

localizedDescriptions.en: Cardio-pulmonary resuscitation is recommended for adult or child.

list.label: CPR attempts not recommended adult or child.

localizedLabels.en: CPR attempts not recommended adult or child.

localizedDescriptions.en: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation is not recommended for adult or child.
There is no clear information on the outcome of the CPR decision.
Modified CPR is recommended for child only.
The date at which the CPR decision was originally taken or last reviewed.
Details of capacity and representation at the time of completion of the ReSPECT form.
Summary of capacity and representation information at the time of completing ReSPECT process.
Does the person have sufficient capacity to participate in making the recommendations on this plan?
Do they have a legal proxy (e.g. welfare attorney, person with parental responsibility) who can participate on their behalf in making the recommendations?
The person has a legal proxy.
The person does not have a legal proxy.
It is not known whether the person has a legal proxy.
Details of those involved and discussions in making the ReSPECT plan.
Details of involvement in making plan.
The clinician(s) signing this plan is/are confirming that these recommendations have at least one of A, B or C or valid reason for not selecting A,B or C fully documented in clinical record.
Details of involvement in making this plan.
This person has the mental capacity to participate in making these recommendations. They have been fully involved in making this plan.

list.label: B Person does not have mental capacity

localizedLabels.en: B Person does not have mental capacity

localizedDescriptions.en: This person does not have the mental capacity to participate in making these recommendations. This plan has been made in accordance with capacity law, including, where applicable, in consultation with their legal proxy, or where no proxy, with relevant family members/friends.

list.label: C1 Person less than 18 or 16 with sufficient maturity

localizedLabels.en: C1 Person less than 18 or 16 with sufficient maturity

localizedDescriptions.en: This person is less than 18 (UK except Scotland) / 16 (Scotland) and they have sufficient maturity and understanding to participate in making this plan.

list.label: C2 Person less than 18 or 16 without sufficient maturity

localizedLabels.en: C2 Person less than 18 or 16 without sufficient maturity

localizedDescriptions.en: This person is less than 18 (UK except Scotland) / 16 (Scotland) and they do not have sufficient maturity and understanding to participate in this plan. Their views, where known, have been taken into account.

list.label: C3 Person less than 18 or 16 parental decision

localizedLabels.en: C3 Person less than 18 or 16 parental decision

localizedDescriptions.en: This person is less than 18 (UK except Scotland) /16 (Scotland) and those holding parental responsibility have been fully involved in discussing and making this plan.
No other option has been selected, and valid reason is stated below. Full explanation is documented in clinical record.

children.name: Reason for not selecting Options A or B or C
children.localizedName: Reason for not selecting Options A or B or C

localizedNames.en: Reason for not selecting Options A or B or C

localizedDescriptions.en: Description of reason for not selecting Options A, B or C or where C1 or C2 is selected without selecting C3.

annotations.comment:
Additional implementation guidance: in an electronic format, if someone selects D we could have a line coming up explaining that the only legal reasons for selecting D are:
1. if the physician thinks it would cause the patient physiological or psychological harm
2. if the patient lacks capacity, and it is not practicable or appropriate to contact those close to them.
If C1 or C2 has been selected without selecting C3, please document why involvement of those holding parental responsibility has not been possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Date when recommendations are made.

children.name: Name and role of those involved in decision making
children.localizedName: Name and role of those involved in decision making

localizedNames.en: Name and role of those involved in decision making

localizedDescriptions.en: Details of clinicians involved in making ReSPECT plan.

annotations.comment: Implementation guidance - Add prompt to UI: The clinical signature is to indicate that the decision-making process has fully complied with relevant capacity and Human Rights legislation.

localizedDescriptions.en: A general clinical activity carried out for the patient to receive a specified service, advice or care from an expert healthcare provider.
Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out.

annotations.comment: Coding of the specific service name with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Practitioner details aligned with FHIR resource.
Practitioner role details aligned with FHIR resource.
Roles which this practitioner may perform.
Name details aligned with FHIR resource.
Identification of the purpose for the name.
The usual name.
The official name.
A temporary name.
A nickname.
An anonymous name.
An old name.
The maiden name.
A text representation of the full name.
Identifier details aligned with FHIR resources or data types.
The identifier value.
The purpose of the identifier.
The usual identifier.
The official identifier.
A temporary identifier.
A secondary identifier.
Details of emergency contacts for ReSPECT plan.
Care team details aligned with FHIR resource.
A label for human use intended to distinguish like teams.
Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care team.
Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care team, such as "Primary care physician", "Trained social worker counselor", "Caregiver", etc.
Contacts for patients and organisations (excluding practitioners).
Name details aligned with FHIR resource.
Identification of the purpose for the name.
The usual name.
The official name.
A temporary name.
A nickname.
An anonymous name.
An old name.
The maiden name.
A text representation of the full name.
FHIR telecom details.
Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.
The communication form is phone.
The communication form is fax.
The communication form is email.
The communication form is URL.
The communication form is pager.
The communication is SMS.
The communication form is other.
The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).
Comments made about the CareTeam.
Details of review dates and clinician for the confirmation of validity (e.g. for change of condition).
A general clinical activity carried out for the patient to receive a specified service, advice or care from an expert healthcare provider.
Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out.

annotations.comment: Coding of the specific service name with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: The date and/or time on which the service is intended to be performed.

annotations.comment: Only for use in association with the 'Service scheduled' pathway step.

localizedDescriptions.en: Practitioner details aligned with FHIR resource.
Practitioner role details aligned with FHIR resource.
Roles which this practitioner may perform.

Identification of the purpose for the name.
The usual name.
The official name.
A temporary name.
A nickname.

The maiden name.
A text representation of the full name.
